messages: 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (19:25): So if Google has it‚Äôs own simple vcard & vevent-based vocabularies, does anyone know if they also map the microformats.org vocabularies in the spec to them?
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (19:25): (for equivalent itemprops?)
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:25): I dunno.  I could ask, though.
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (19:26): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: searching Google help atm, but not finding anything‚Ä¶
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (19:27): oh, maybe I should just make a test page and try it in the testing tool

1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (19:34): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: Rich Snippets testing tool feedback ‚ÄúWarnings : Itemtype not recognized‚Äù - this is using Google-provided http://www.data-vocabulary.org/Person/ and /Organization/ (guess it‚Äôs a bug)
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:34): Test page?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (19:36): 1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f: From the examples, it looks like you shouldn't have the trailing / on the URLs
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (19:38): http://oli-studio.com/test/microdata-2.html
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (19:39): thanks ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c will try (c&p from URL bar getting me into trouble)
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (19:41): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: wins the gold star (I get to sit in the corner)
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:42): That's the problem with urls-as-ids - they tend to have only a single acceptable form, while urls-as-urls have multiple equivalent forms.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (19:42): Except when they don't
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:45): Sure, but most of the time example.com, example.com/, www.example.com, www.example.com:80/, etc. all work.

1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (19:46): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: yeah I noticed that the data-vocabulary ones are annoyingly case-sensitive for standard loading (didn‚Äôt test with microdata parsing)
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (19:47): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: also /Recipe was mentioned in the announcement/in rich snippets help, but is 404 on www.data-vocabulary.org/Recipe

1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (19:48): Rich Snippets testing tool gets http://microformats.org/profile/hcard but gives itemtype not recognised for http://microformats.org/profile/hcalendar#vevent (with/without #vevent)
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (19:48): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: tell me to stop anytime :)
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:49): I really dunno much about it, so I'll collect them together and test sometime later.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (19:49): Then do bug reports as necessary.
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (19:50): (same test file using microformats.org vocabularies is http://oli-studio.com/test/microdata-2.html btw)
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (19:50): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: bug reports? that was a very restrained sigh then ;)
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (19:51): seems that using data-vocabulary.org leads to extracted data, and microformats.org doesn‚Äôt. hrm
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (19:52): that makes WHATWG microdata vocabularies quite a bit less appealing huh
1e10d84b3917ae58049be95b0071cf7f (19:53): (I‚Äôd hoped that as the WHATWG vocabularies are a superset, the equivalent properties would still be recognised by Rich Snippets)
